newsitem.title: USA: NVID says its prospects compromised.
newsitem.headline: NVID says its prospects compromised.

text.p: NVID International Inc said that the U.S. District Judge for the Middle District of Florida entered an order releasing and discharging NVID and Andrew Arata from the preliminary injunction that froze their assets.
The release and discharge of this freeze will allow the company to resume business operations, NVID said.

The company issued a news release saying investors should be cautioned that as a result of the significant delay caused by the freeze and interruption of the company's business activities, that "the company's prospects have been significantly compromised."
The company said it intends to begin immediately filling existing orders and shipping its ionization products to the company's dealers.
The company said it had a limited number of orders for its products prior to the imposition of the court's order.
"It should be anticipated that the resulting delay has impacted some of these orders," NVID said.
Management is instituting many cost saving measures to reduce expenses, the company said.
